SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: Imported and ACM-issued certificates should be renewed after a specified time period
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether an AWS Certificate Manager (ACM) certificate is renewed within the specified time period. It checks both imported certificates and certificates provided by ACM. The control fails if the certificate isn't renewed within the specified time period. Unless you provide a custom parameter value for the renewal period, Security Hub uses a default value of 30 days.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: RSA certificates managed by ACM should use a key length of at least 2,048 bits
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether RSA certificates managed by AWS Certificate Manager use a key length of at least 2,048 bits. The control fails if the key length is smaller than 2,048 bits.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: API Gateway REST and WebSocket API execution logging should be enabled
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether all stages of an Amazon API Gateway REST or WebSocket API have logging enabled. The control fails if the 'loggingLevel' isn't 'ERROR' or 'INFO' for all stages of the API. Unless you provide custom parameter values to indicate that a specific log type should be enabled, Security Hub produces a passed finding if the logging level is either 'ERROR' or 'INFO'.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: API Gateway REST API stages should be configured to use SSL certificates for backend authentication
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether Amazon API Gateway REST API stages have SSL certificates configured that backend systems can use to authenticate that incoming requests are from the API Gateway.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: API Gateway REST API stages should have AWS X-Ray tracing enabled
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether AWS X-Ray active tracing is enabled for your Amazon API Gateway REST API stages.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: API Gateway should be associated with a WAF Web ACL
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks to see if an API Gateway stage is using an AWS WAF Web ACL. This control fails if an AWS WAF Web ACL is not attached to a REST API Gateway stage.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: API Gateway REST API cache data should be encrypted at rest
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether all methods in Amazon API Gateway REST API stages that have cache enabled are encrypted. The control fails if any method in API Gateway REST API stage is configured to cache and the cache is not encrypted.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: API Gateway routes should specify an authorization type
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks if Amazon API Gateway routes have an authorization type. The control fails if the API Gateway route doesn't have any authorization type. Optionally, you can provide a custom parameter value if you want the control to pass only if the route uses the authorization type specified in the 'authorizationType' parameter.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: Access logging should be configured for API Gateway V2 Stages
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks if Amazon API Gateway V2 stages have access logging configured. This control fails if access log settings aren’t defined.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: Security contact information should be provided for an AWS account.
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks if an Amazon Web Services (AWS) account has security contact information. The control fails if security contact information is not provided for the account.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: AWS AppSync API caches should be encrypted at rest
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether an AWS AppSync API cache is encrypted at rest. The control fails if the API cache isn't encrypted at rest.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: AWS AppSync should have field-level logging enabled
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether an AWS AppSync API has field-level logging turned on. The control fails if the field resolver log level is set to 'None'. Unless you provide custom parameter values to indicate that a specific log type should be enabled, Security Hub produces a passed finding if the field resolver log level is either 'ERROR' or 'ALL'.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: AWS AppSync GraphQL APIs should not be authenticated with API keys
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether your application uses an API key to interact with an AWS AppSync GraphQL API. The control fails if an AWS AppSync GraphQL API is authenticated with an API key.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: AWS AppSync API caches should be encrypted in transit
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether an AWS AppSync API cache is encrypted in transit. The control fails if the API cache isn't encrypted in transit.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: Athena workgroups should have logging enabled
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon Athena workgroup has logging enabled. The control fails if the workgroup doesn't have logging enabled.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: Auto scaling groups associated with a load balancer should use ELB health checks
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling group that is associated with a load balancer uses Elastic Load Balancing (ELB) health checks. The control fails if the Auto Scaling group doesn't use ELB health checks.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling group should cover multiple Availability Zones
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling group spans at least the specified number of Availability Zones (AZs). The control fails if an Auto Scaling group doesn't span at least the specified number of AZs. Unless you provide a custom parameter value for the minimum number of AZs, Security Hub uses a default value of two AZs.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: Auto Scaling group launch configurations should configure EC2 instances to require Instance Metadata Service Version 2 (IMDSv2)
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether IMDSv2 is enabled on all instances launched by Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling groups. The control fails if the Instance Metadata Service (IMDS) version isn't included in the launch configuration or is configured as token optional, which is a setting that allows either IMDSv1 or IMDSv2.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: Auto Scaling groups should use multiple instance types in multiple Availability Zones
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling group uses multiple instance types. This control fails if the Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling group has only one instance type defined.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: EC2 Auto Scaling groups should use EC2 launch templates
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling group is created from an EC2 launch template. This control fails if an Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling group is not created with a launch template or if a launch template is not specified in a mixed instances policy.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: Amazon EC2 instances launched using Auto Scaling group launch configurations should not have Public IP addresses
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling groups have public IP addresses enabled using launch configurations.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: AWS Backup recovery points should be encrypted at rest
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks if an AWS Backup recovery point is encrypted at rest. The control fails if the recovery point isn't encrypted at rest.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: CloudFront distributions should have a default root object configured
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon CloudFront distribution is configured to return a specific object that is the default root object. The control fails if the CloudFront distribution does not have a default root object configured.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: CloudFront distributions should not use deprecated SSL protocols between edge locations and custom origins
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks if CloudFront distributions are using deprecated SSL protocols for HTTPS communication between CloudFront edge locations and your custom origins. This control fails for a CloudFront distribution if it has a 'CustomOriginConfig' where ‘OriginSslProtocols’ includes ‘SSLv3’.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: CloudFront distributions should not point to non-existent S3 origins
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether Amazon CloudFront distributions are pointing to non-existent S3 origins. The control fails for a CloudFront distribution if the origin is configured to point to a non-existent bucket. This control only applies to CloudFront distributions where an S3 bucket without static website hosting is the S3 origin.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: CloudFront distributions should use origin access control
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon CloudFront distribution with an Amazon S3 origin has origin access control (OAC) configured. The control fails if OAC isn't configured.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: CloudFront distributions should require encryption in transit
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon CloudFront distribution requires viewers to use HTTPS directly, or whether it uses redirection. The control fails if ViewerProtocolPolicy is set to allow-all for defaultCacheBehavior or for cacheBehaviors.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: CloudFront distributions should have origin failover configured
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon CloudFront distribution is configured with an origin group that has 2 or more origins.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: CloudFront distributions should have logging enabled
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks to see if server access logging is enabled on Amazon CloudFront Distributions. The control will fail if access logging is not enabled for the distribution.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: CloudFront distributions should have WAF enabled
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks to see if Amazon CloudFront distributions are associated with either WAF or WAFv2 web ACLs. The control fails if a CloudFront distribution is not associated with a web ACL.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: CloudFront distributions should use custom SSL/TLS certificates
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks if CloudFront distributions are using the default SSL/TLS certificate CloudFront provides instead of a custom one. This control fails for a CloudFront distribution if it uses the default SSL/TLS certificate.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: CloudFront distributions should use SNI to serve HTTPS requests
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks if Amazon CloudFront distributions are using a custom SSL/TLS certificate and are configured to use SNI to serve HTTPS requests as opposed to dedicated IP address.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: CloudFront distributions should encrypt traffic to custom origins
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks if CloudFront distributions are encrypting traffic to custom origins. This control fails if ‘OriginProtocolPolicy’ is ‘http-only’ or if ‘OriginProtocolPolicy’ is ‘match-viewer’ and ‘ViewerProtocolPolicy’ is ‘allow-all’.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: CloudTrail should be enabled and configured with at least one multi-Region trail that includes read and write management events
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This AWS control checks that there is at least one multi-region AWS CloudTrail trail includes read and write management events.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: CloudTrail should have encryption at-rest enabled
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This AWS control checks whether AWS CloudTrail is configured to use the server side encryption (SSE) AWS Key Management Service (AWS KMS) customer master key (CMK) encryption. The check will pass if the KmsKeyId is defined.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: CloudTrail log file validation should be enabled
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This AWS control checks whether CloudTrail log file validation is enabled.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: CloudTrail trails should be integrated with Amazon CloudWatch Logs
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This AWS control checks whether AWS CloudTrail trails are configured to send logs to Amazon CloudWatch Logs.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: CodeBuild Bitbucket source repository URLs should not contain sensitive credentials
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether an AWS CodeBuild project Bitbucket source repository URL contains personal access tokens or a user name and password. The control fails if the Bitbucket source repository URL contains personal access tokens or a user name and password.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: CodeBuild project environment variables should not contain clear text credentials
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This AWS control checks whether the project contains environment variables AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID and AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: CodeBuild S3 logs should be encrypted
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks if Amazon S3 logs for an AWS CodeBuild project are encrypted. The control fails if encryption is deactivated for S3 Logs for a CodeBuild project.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: CodeBuild project environments should have a logging configuration
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether a CodeBuild project environment has at least one log option enabled.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: CodeBuild report group exports should be encrypted at rest
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether the test results of an AWS CodeBuild report group that are exported to an Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) bucket are encrypted at rest. The control fails if the report group export isn't encrypted at rest.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: Cognito user pools should have threat protection activated with full function enforcement mode for standard authentication
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon Cognito user pool has threat protection activated with the enforcement mode set to full function for standard authentication. The control fails if the user pool has threat protection deactivated or if the enforcement mode isn't set to full function for standard authentication.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: AWS Config should be enabled and use the service-linked role for resource recording
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether AWS Config is enabled in your account in the current AWS Region, records all resources that correspond to controls that are enabled in the current Region, and uses the service-linked AWS Config role.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: Amazon Connect instances should have CloudWatch logging enabled
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon Connect instance is configured to generate and store flow logs in an Amazon CloudWatch log group. The control fails if the Amazon Connect instance isn't configured to generate and store flow logs in a CloudWatch log group.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: Database Migration Service replication instances should not be public
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This AWS control checks whether AWS Database Migration Service replication instances are public by examining the PubliclyAccessible field value.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: DMS endpoints for Neptune databases should have IAM authorization enabled
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether an AWS DMS endpoint for an Amazon Neptune database is configured with IAM authorization. The control fails if the DMS endpoint doesn't have IAM authorization enabled.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: DMS endpoints for MongoDB should have an authentication mechanism enabled
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether an AWS DMS endpoint for MongoDB is configured with an authentication mechanism. The control fails if an authentication type isn't set for the endpoint.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: DMS endpoints for Redis OSS should have TLS enabled
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether an AWS DMS endpoint for Redis OSS is configured with a TLS connection. The control fails if the endpoint doesn't have TLS enabled.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: DMS replication instances should have automatic minor version upgrade enabled
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks if automatic minor version upgrade is enabled for an AWS DMS replication instance. The control fails if automatic minor version upgrade isn't enabled for a DMS replication instance.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: DMS replication tasks for the target database should have logging enabled
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether logging is enabled with the minimum severity level of LOGGER_SEVERITY_DEFAULT for DMS replication task events TARGET_APPLY and TARGET_LOAD. The control fails if logging isn't enabled for these events or if the minimum severity level is less than LOGGER_SEVERITY_DEFAULT.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: DMS replication tasks for the source database should have logging enabled
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: The control checks whether logging is enabled with the minimum severity level of LOGGER_SEVERITY_DEFAULT for DMS replication task events SOURCE_CAPTURE and SOURCE_UNLOAD. The control fails if logging isn't enabled for these events of the source database or if the minimum severity level is less than LOGGER_SEVERITY_DEFAULT.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: DMS endpoints should use SSL
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether an AWS DMS endpoint uses an SSL connection. The control fails if the endpoint doesn't use SSL.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: Firehose delivery streams should be encrypted at rest
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon Data Firehose delivery stream is encrypted at rest with server-side encryption. This control fails if the delivery stream is not encrypted at rest with server-side encryption.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: DataSync tasks should have logging enabled
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether an AWS DataSync task has logging enabled. The control fails if the task doesn't have logging enabled.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: Amazon DocumentDB clusters should be encrypted at rest
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon DocumentDB cluster is encrypted at rest. The control fails if an Amazon DocumentDB cluster isn't encrypted at rest.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: Amazon DocumentDB clusters should have an adequate backup retention period
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon DocumentDB cluster has a backup retention period greater than or equal to the specified time frame. The control fails if the backup retention period is less than the specified time frame. Unless you provide a custom parameter value for the backup retention period, Security Hub uses a default value of 7 days.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: Amazon DocumentDB manual cluster snapshots should not be public
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon DocumentDB manual snapshot is public. The control fails if the manual snapshot is public.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: Amazon DocumentDB clusters should publish audit logs to CloudWatch Logs
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether a DocumentDB cluster publishes audit logs to Amazon CloudWatch Logs. The control fails if a DocumentDB cluster doesn't publish audit logs to CloudWatch Logs.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: Amazon DocumentDB clusters should have deletion protection enabled
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks if an Amazon Document DB cluster has deletion protection enabled. This control fails if the cluster doesn't have deletion protection enabled.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: Amazon DocumentDB clusters should be encrypted in transit
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This controls checks whether an Amazon DocumentDB cluster requires TLS for connections to the cluster. The control fails if the cluster parameter group associated with the cluster is not in sync, or the TLS cluster parameter is set to 'disabled' or 'enabled'.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: DynamoDB tables should automatically scale capacity with demand
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon DynamoDB table can scale its read and write capacity as needed. The control fails if the table doesn't use on-demand capacity mode or provisioned mode with auto scaling configured. By default, this control only requires that one of these modes be configured, without regard to specific levels of read or write capacity. Optionally, you can provide custom parameter values to require specific levels of read and write capacity.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: DynamoDB tables should have point-in-time recovery enabled
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether point-in-time recovery (PITR) is enabled for a DynamoDB table.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: DynamoDB Accelerator (DAX) clusters should be encrypted at rest
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether a DAX cluster is encrypted at rest.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: DynamoDB tables should have deletion protection enabled
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon DynamoDB table has deletion protection enabled. The control fails if a DynamoDB table doesn't have deletion protection enabled.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: DynamoDB Accelerator clusters should be encrypted in transit
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon DynamoDB Accelerator (DAX) cluster is encrypted in transit, with the endpoint encryption type set to TLS. The control fails if the DAX cluster isn't encrypted in transit.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: EBS snapshots should not be publicly restorable
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This AWS control checks whether Amazon Elastic Block Store snapshots are not publicly restorable.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: Amazon EC2 should be configured to use VPC endpoints that are created for the Amazon EC2 service
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether a service endpoint for Amazon EC2 is created for each VPC. The control fails if a VPC does not have a VPC endpoint created for the Amazon EC2 service.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: EC2 subnets should not automatically assign public IP addresses
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks if the assignment of public IPs in Amazon Virtual Private Cloud (VPC) subnets have the MapPublicIpOnLaunch set to FALSE. The control will pass if the flag is set to FALSE.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: Unused Network Access Control Lists should be removed
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks to see if there are any NACLs (Network Access Control List) that are unused. The control will check the item configuration of the resource AWS::EC2::NetworkAcl and determine the relationships of the NACL.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: EC2 instances should not use multiple ENIs
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks to see if Amazon EC2 instance uses multiple ENI/EFA. This control will pass if single network adapters is used.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: EC2 launch templates should use Instance Metadata Service Version 2 (IMDSv2)
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon EC2 launch template is configured with Instance Metadata Service Version 2 (IMDSv2). The control fails if HttpTokens is set to optional.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: EC2 VPN connections should have logging enabled
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether an AWS Site-to-Site VPN connection has Amazon CloudWatch Logs enabled for both tunnels. The control fails if a Site-to-Site VPN connection doesn't have CloudWatch Logs enabled for both tunnels.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: EC2 VPC Block Public Access settings should block internet gateway traffic
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether Amazon EC2 VPC Block Public Access (BPA) settings are configured to block internet gateway traffic for all Amazon VPCs in the AWS account. The control fails if EC2 VPC BPA settings aren't configured to block internet gateway traffic. If the parameter `vpcBpaInternetGatewayBlockMode` is provided, the control passes only if the EC2 VPC BPA value for InternetGatewayBlockMode matches the parameter.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: EC2 Spot Fleet requests should enable encryption for attached EBS volumes
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon EC2 Spot Fleet request enables encryption for all Amazon Elastic Block Store (Amazon EBS) volumes attached to EC2 instances. The control fails if the Spot Fleet request doesn't enable encryption for one or more EBS volumes specified in the request.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: Security groups should only allow unrestricted incoming traffic for authorized ports
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon EC2 security group permits unrestricted incoming traffic from unauthorized ports. The control status is determined as follows: If you use the default value for 'authorizedTcpPorts', the control fails if the security group permits unrestricted incoming traffic from any port other than ports 80 and 443; If you provide custom values for 'authorizedTcpPorts' or 'authorizedUdpPorts', the control fails if the security group permits unrestricted incoming traffic from any unlisted port; If no parameter is used, the control fails for any security group that has an unrestricted inbound traffic rule.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: Security groups should not allow unrestricted access to ports with high risk
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether unrestricted incoming traffic for an Amazon EC2 security group is accessible to the specified ports [3389, 20, 23, 110, 143, 3306, 8080, 1433, 9200, 9300, 25, 445, 135, 21, 1434, 4333, 5432, 5500, 5601, 22, 3000, 5000, 8088, 8888] that are considered to be high risk. This control fails if any of the rules in a security group allow ingress traffic from '0.0.0.0/0' or '::/0' to those ports.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: VPC default security groups should not allow inbound or outbound traffic
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This AWS control checks that the default security group of a VPC does not allow inbound or outbound traffic.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: Both VPN tunnels for an AWS Site-to-Site VPN connection should be up
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks that both VPN tunnels provided by AWS Site-to-Site VPN are in UP status. The control fails if one or both tunnels are in DOWN status.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: Network ACLs should not allow ingress from 0.0.0.0/0 to port 22 or port 3389
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether a network access control list (NACL) allows unrestricted access to the default ports for SSH/RDP ingress traffic. The rule fails if a NACL inbound entry allows a source CIDR block of '0.0.0.0/0' or '::/0' for ports 22 or 3389

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: EC2 Transit Gateways should not automatically accept VPC attachment requests
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks if EC2 Transit Gateways are automatically accepting shared VPC attachments requests. This control will fail for a Transit Gateway that automatically accept shared VPC attachment requests.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: EC2 paravirtual instance types should not be used
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether the virtualization type of an EC2 instance is paravirtual. The control fails for an EC2 instance if ‘virtualizationType’ is set to ‘paravirtual’.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: EC2 launch templates should not assign public IPs to network interfaces
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks if Amazon EC2 launch templates are configured to assign public IP addresses to network interfaces upon launch. The control fails if an EC2 launch template is configured to assign a public IP address to network interfaces or if there is at least one network interface that has a public IP address.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: Attached EBS volumes should be encrypted at-rest
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This AWS control checks whether the EBS volumes that are in an attached state are encrypted.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: Stopped EC2 instances should be removed after a specified time period
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon EC2 instance has been stopped for longer than the allowed number of days. The control fails if an EC2 instance is stopped for longer than the maximum allowed time period. Unless you provide a custom parameter value for the maximum allowed time period, Security Hub uses a default value of 30 days.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: EC2 Client VPN endpoints should have client connection logging enabled
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks if an AWS Client VPN endpoint has client connection logging enabled. The control fails if the endpoint doesn't have client connection logging enabled.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: VPCs should be configured with an interface endpoint for ECR API
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether a virtual private cloud (VPC) that you manage has an interface VPC endpoint for ECR API. The control fails if the VPC doesn't have an interface VPC endpoint for ECR API. This control evaluates resources in a single account.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: VPCs should be configured with an interface endpoint for Docker Registry
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether a virtual private cloud (VPC) that you manage has an interface VPC endpoint for Docker Registry. The control fails if the VPC doesn't have an interface VPC endpoint for Docker Registry. This control evaluates resources in a single account.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: VPCs should be configured with an interface endpoint for Systems Manager
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether a virtual private cloud (VPC) that you manage has an interface VPC endpoint for Systems Manager. The control fails if the VPC doesn't have an interface VPC endpoint for Systems Manager. This control evaluates resources in a single account.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: VPCs should be configured with an interface endpoint for Systems Manager Incident Manager Contacts
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether a virtual private cloud (VPC) that you manage has an interface VPC endpoint for Systems Manager Incident Manager Contacts. The control fails if the VPC doesn't have an interface VPC endpoint for Systems Manager Incident Manager Contacts. This control evaluates resources in a single account.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: VPC flow logging should be enabled in all VPCs
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether Amazon Virtual Private Cloud flow logs are found and enabled for Amazon VPCs. The traffic type is set to 'Reject'.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: VPCs should be configured with an interface endpoint for Systems Manager Incident Manager
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether a virtual private cloud (VPC) that you manage has an interface VPC endpoint for Systems Manager Incident Manager. The control fails if the VPC doesn't have an interface VPC endpoint for Systems Manager Incident Manager. This control evaluates resources in a single account.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: EBS default encryption should be enabled
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether Amazon Elastic Block Store (EBS) encryption is enabled by default. The control fails if EBS default encryption is not enabled.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: EC2 instances should use Instance Metadata Service Version 2 (IMDSv2)
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether your Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2) instance metadata version is configured with Instance Metadata Service Version 2 (IMDSv2). The control passes if HttpTokens is set to required for IMDSv2. The control fails if HttpTokens is set to optional.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: EC2 instances should not have a public IPv4 address
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether EC2 instances have a public IP address. The control fails if the publicIp field is present in the EC2 instance configuration item. This control applies to IPv4 addresses only.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: ECR private repositories should have image scanning configured
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether a private ECR repository has image scanning configured. This control fails if a private ECR repository doesn’t have image scanning configured.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: ECR private repositories should have tag immutability configured
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether a private ECR repository has tag immutability configured. This control fails if a private ECR repository has tag immutability disabled. This rule passes if tag immutability is configured and has the value IMMUTABLE

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: ECR repositories should have at least one lifecycle policy configured
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether an ECR repository has at least one lifecycle policy configured. This control fails if an ECR repository does not have any lifecycle policies configured.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: Amazon ECS task definitions should have secure networking modes and user definitions.
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks if an Amazon ECS Task Definition with host networking mode has "privileged" or "user" container definitions. The control fails with host network mode and container definitions are privileged=false or empty and user=root or empty.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: ECS Fargate services should run on the latest Fargate platform version
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks if ECS Fargate services is running the latest Fargate platform version. This control fails if the platform version is not latest.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: ECS clusters should use Container Insights
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks if ECS clusters use Container Insights. This control fails if Container Insights are not set up for a cluster.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: ECS task sets should not automatically assign public IP addresses
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon ECS task set is configured to automatically assign public IP addresses. The control fails if 'AssignPublicIP' is set to 'ENABLED'.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: ECS services should not have public IP addresses assigned to them automatically
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether ECS services are configured to automatically assign public IP addresses. This control fails if AssignPublicIP is ENABLED.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: ECS task definitions should not share the host's process namespace
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks if Amazon ECS task definitions are configured to share a host's process namespace with its containers. This control fails if the task definition shares the host's process namespace with the containers running on it

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: ECS containers should run as non-privileged
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks if the privileged parameter in the container definition of Amazon ECS task definitions is set to 'true'. This control fails if this parameter is equal to 'true'.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: ECS containers should be limited to read-only access to root filesystems
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks if ECS containers are limited to read-only access to mounted root filesystems. This control fails if the ReadonlyRootFilesystem parameter in the container definition of ECS task definitions is set to ‘false’.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: Secrets should not be passed as container environment variables
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks if the key value of any variables in the ‘environment’ parameter of container definitions includes - AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID, AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY,  or ECS_ENGINE_AUTH_DATA.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: ECS task definitions should have a logging configuration
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks if the latest active Amazon ECS task definition has a logging configuration specified. The control fails if the task definition doesn't have the logConfiguration property defined or if the value for logDriver is null in at least one container definition.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: Elastic File System should be configured to encrypt file data at-rest using AWS KMS
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This AWS control checks whether Amazon Elastic File System (Amazon EFS) is configured to encrypt the file data using AWS Key Management Service (AWS KMS). The check will fail if the encrypted key is set to false on DescribeFileSystems or if the KmsKeyId key on DescribeFileSystems does not match the KmsKeyId parameter.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: Amazon EFS volumes should be in backup plans
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether Amazon Elastic File System (Amazon EFS) file systems are added to the backup plans in AWS Backup. The control fails if EFS file systems are not included in the backup plans.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: EFS access points should enforce a root directory
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks if Amazon Elastic File System (Amazon EFS) access points are configured to enforce a root directory. This control fails if the value of 'Path' is set to '/' (default root directory of the file system).

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: EFS access points should enforce a user identity
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether Amazon Elastic File System (Amazon EFS) access points are configured to enforce a user identity. This control fails if ‘PosixUser’ is not defined under ‘configuration’ or if parameters are provided and there is no match in the corresponding parameter.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: EFS mount targets should not be associated with a public subnet
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon EFS mount target is associated with a private subnet. The control fails if the mount target is associated with a public subnet.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: EFS file systems should have automatic backups enabled
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon EFS file system has automatic backups enabled. This control fails if the EFS file system doesn't have automatic backups enabled.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: EFS file systems should be encrypted at rest
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon EFS file system encrypts data with AWS Key Management Service (AWS KMS). The control fails if a file system isn't encrypted. Optionally, you can include the kmsKeyArns parameter to check if a file system is encrypted with specified KMS keys.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: EKS cluster endpoints should not be publicly accessible
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon EKS cluster endpoint is publicly accessible. The control fails if an EKS cluster has an endpoint that is publicly accessible.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: EKS clusters should run on a supported Kubernetes version
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether an EKS cluster is running on a supported Kubernetes version. The control fails if the EKS cluster is running on an unsupported version.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: EKS clusters should use encrypted Kubernetes secrets
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon EKS cluster uses encrypted Kubernetes secrets. The control fails if the cluster's Kubernetes secrets aren't encrypted.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: EKS clusters should have audit logging enabled
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon EKS cluster has audit logging enabled. The control fails if audit logging isn't enabled for the cluster.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: Application Load Balancer should be configured to redirect all HTTP requests to HTTPS
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This AWS control checks whether HTTP to HTTPS redirection is configured on all HTTP listeners of Application Load Balancers. The control will fail if one or more HTTP listeners of Application Load Balancers do not have HTTP to HTTPS redirection configured.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: Classic Load Balancer should span multiple Availability Zones
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether a Classic Load Balancer has been configured to span at least the specified number of Availability Zones (AZs). The control fails if the Classic Load Balancer does not span at least the specified number of AZs. Unless you provide a custom parameter value for the minimum number of AZs, Security Hub uses a default value of two AZs.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: Application Load Balancer should be configured with defensive or strictest desync mitigation mode
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether the Application Load Balancer is configured with defensive or strictest de-sync mitigation mode. This control fails if the Application Load Balancer is not configured with defensive or strictest desync mitigation mode.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: Application, Network and Gateway Load Balancers should span multiple Availability Zones
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether an Elastic Load Balancer V2 (Application, Network, or Gateway Load Balancer) has registered instances from at least the specified number of Availability Zones (AZs). The control fails if an Elastic Load Balancer V2 doesn't have instances registered in at least the specified number of AZs. Unless you provide a custom parameter value for the minimum number of AZs, Security Hub uses a default value of two AZs.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: Classic Load Balancer should be configured with defensive or strictest desync mitigation mode
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether the Classic Load Balancer is configured with defensive or strictest desync mitigation mode. This control will fail if the Classic Load Balancer is not configured with defensive or strictest desync mitigation mode.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: Application and Network Load Balancers with listeners should use recommended security policies
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether the HTTPS listener for an Application Load Balancer or the TLS listener for a Network Load Balancer is configured to encrypt data in transit by using a recommended security policy. The control fails if the HTTPS or TLS listener for a load balancer isn't configured to use a recommended security policy.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: Classic Load Balancers with SSL/HTTPS listeners should use a certificate provided by AWS Certificate Manager
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether a Classic Load Balancer uses HTTPS/SSL certificates provided by AWS Certificate Manager. The control fails if a Classic Load Balancer that is configured with an HTTPS/SSL listener does not use a certificate provided by AWS Certificate Manager.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: Classic Load Balancer listeners should be configured with HTTPS or TLS termination
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether your Classic Load Balancer listeners are configured with HTTPS or TLS protocol for front-end (client to load balancer) connections. The control is applicable if a Classic Load Balancer has listeners. If your Classic Load Balancer does not have a listener configured, then the control does not report any findings.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: Application load balancer should be configured to drop invalid http headers
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control evaluates AWS Application Load Balancers (ALB) to ensure they are configured to drop invalid http headers. By default, ALBs are not configured to drop invalid http header values. This control evaluates all ALBs fails if the attribute value of routing.http.drop_invalid_header_fields.enabled is set to false.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: Application and Classic Load Balancers logging should be enabled
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether the Application Load Balancer and the Classic Load Balancer have logging enabled. The control fails if the access_logs.s3.enabled is false.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: Application, Gateway, and Network Load Balancers should have deletion protection enabled
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether Application, Gateway, and Network Load Balancers have deletion protection enabled. The control fails if deletion protection is disabled.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: Classic Load Balancers should have connection draining enabled
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether AWS Classic Load Balancers have connection draining enabled.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: Classic Load Balancers with SSL listeners should use a predefined security policy that has strong configuration
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether your Classic Load Balancer SSL listeners use the predefined policy ELBSecurityPolicy-TLS-1-2-2017-01. The control fails if the Classic Load Balancer SSL listeners do not use the predefined policy ELBSecurityPolicy-TLS-1-2-2017-01.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: Classic Load Balancers should have cross-zone load balancing enabled
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether cross-zone load balancing is enabled for Classic Load Balancers. This control fails if cross-zone load balancing is not enabled for a Classic Load Balancer.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: Amazon EMR cluster primary nodes should not have public IP addresses
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether primary nodes on EMR clusters have public IP addresses.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: Amazon EMR block public access setting should be enabled
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether your account is configured with Amazon EMR block public access. The control fails if the block public access setting is not enabled or if any port other than 22 is allowed.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: Amazon EMR security configurations should have encryption at rest enabled
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon EMR security configuration has encryption at rest enabled. The control fails if the security configuration doesn't enable encryption at rest.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: Amazon EMR security configurations should have encryption in transit enabled
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon EMR security configuration has encryption in transit enabled. The control fails if the security configuration doesn't enable encryption in transit.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: Elasticsearch domains should have encryption at-rest enabled
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This AWS control checks whether Elasticsearch domains have encryption at rest configuration enabled. This check fails if the EncryptionAtRestOptions field is not enabled.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: Elasticsearch domains should not be publicly accessible
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether an Elasticsearch domain is publicly accessible. The control fails if an Elasticsearch domain is publicly accessible. It does not evaluate the VPC subnet routing configuration to determine public access.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: Elasticsearch domains should encrypt data sent between nodes
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether Elasticsearch domains have node-to-node encryption enabled.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: Elasticsearch domain error logging to CloudWatch Logs should be enabled
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether Elasticsearch domains are configured to send error logs to CloudWatch Logs.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: Elasticsearch domains should have audit logging enabled
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether Elasticsearch domains have audit logging enabled. This control fails if an Elasticsearch domain does not have audit logging enabled.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: Elasticsearch domains should have at least three data nodes
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether Elasticsearch domains are configured with at least three data nodes and zoneAwarenessEnabled is true.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: Elasticsearch domains should be configured with at least three dedicated master nodes
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether Elasticsearch domains are configured with at least three dedicated master nodes. This control fails if dedicatedMasterEnabled is not true.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: Connections to Elasticsearch domains should be encrypted using the latest TLS security policy
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This controls checks whether connections to an Elasticsearch domain are using the latest TLS security policy. The control fails if the Elasticsearch domain isn't using the latest supported policy or if HTTPs isn't enabled.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: ElastiCache (Redis OSS) clusters should have automatic backups enabled
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control evaluates whether an Amazon ElastiCache (Redis OSS) cluster has automatic backups enabled. The control fails if the 'SnapshotRetentionLimit' for the Redis OSS cluster is less than the specified time period. Unless you provide a custom parameter value for the snapshot retention period, Security Hub uses a default value of 1 day.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: ElastiCache clusters should have automatic minor version upgrades enabled
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control evaluates whether ElastiCache automatically applies minor version upgrades to a cache cluster. The control fails if the cache cluster doesn't have minor version upgrades automatically applied.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: ElastiCache replication groups should have automatic failover enabled
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether an ElastiCache replication group has automatic failover enabled. The control fails if automatic failover isn't enabled for an ElastiCache replication group.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: ElastiCache replication groups should be encrypted at rest
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether an ElastiCache replication group is encrypted at rest. The control fails if an ElastiCache replication group isn't encrypted at rest.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: ElastiCache replication groups should be encrypted in transit
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether an ElastiCache replication group is encrypted in transit. The control fails if an ElastiCache replication group isn't encrypted in transit.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: ElastiCache (Redis OSS) replication groups of earlier versions should have Redis OSS AUTH enabled
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether an ElastiCache (Redis OSS) replication group has Redis OSS AUTH enabled. The control fails if the Redis OSS version of the replication group nodes is below 6.0 and 'AuthToken' isn't in use.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: ElastiCache clusters should not use the default subnet group
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether an ElastiCache cluster is configured with a custom subnet group. The control fails if an ElastiCache cluster is using a default subnet group.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: Elastic Beanstalk environments should have enhanced health reporting enabled
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether enhanced health reporting is enabled for your AWS Elastic Beanstalk environments.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: Elastic Beanstalk managed platform updates should be enabled
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether managed platform updates are enabled for an Elastic Beanstalk environment. The control fails if no managed platform updates are enabled. By default, the control passes if any type of platform update is enabled. Optionally, you can provide a custom parameter value to require a specific update level.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: Elastic Beanstalk should stream logs to CloudWatch
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether an Elastic Beanstalk environment is configured to send logs to CloudWatch Logs. The control fails if an Elastic Beanstalk environment isn't configured to send logs to CloudWatch Logs. Optionally, you can provide a custom value for the 'RetentionInDays' parameter if you want the control to pass only if logs are retained for the specified number of days before expiration.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: EventBridge custom event buses should have a resource-based policy attached
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks if an Amazon EventBridge custom event bus has a resource policy attached. This control fails if the custom event bus doesn't have a resource policy.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: FSx for OpenZFS file systems should be configured to copy tags to backups and volumes
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks if an Amazon FSx for OpenZFS file system is configured to copy tags to backups and volumes. The control fails if the OpenZFS file system isn't configured to copy tags to backups and volumes.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: FSx for Lustre file systems should be configured to copy tags to backups
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon FSx for Lustre file system is configured to copy tags to backups. This control fails if the Lustre file system isn't configured to copy tags to backups.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: FSx for OpenZFS file systems should be configured for Multi-AZ deployment
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon FSx for OpenZFS file system is configured to use the multiple Availability Zones (Multi-AZ) deployment type. The control fails if the file system isn't configured to use the Multi-AZ deployment type.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: FSx for NetApp ONTAP file systems should be configured for Multi-AZ deployment
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon FSx for NetApp ONTAP file system is configured to use a multiple Availability Zones (Multi-AZ) deployment type. The control fails if the file system isn't configured to use a Multi-AZ deployment type. You can optionally specify a list of deployment types to include in the evaluation.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: FSx for Windows File Server file systems should be configured for Multi-AZ deployment
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon FSx for Windows File Server file system is configured to use the multiple Availability Zones (Multi-AZ) deployment type. The control fails if the file system isn't configured to use the Multi-AZ deployment type.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: AWS Glue machine learning transforms should be encrypted at rest
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether an AWS Glue machine learning transform is encrypted at rest. The control fails if the machine learning transform isn't encrypted at rest.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: AWS Glue Spark jobs should run on supported versions of AWS Glue
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether an AWS Glue for Spark job is configured to run on a supported version of AWS Glue. The control fails if the Spark job is configured to run on a version of AWS Glue that's earlier than the minimum supported version.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: GuardDuty should be enabled
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This AWS control checks whether Amazon GuardDuty is enabled in your AWS account and region.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: GuardDuty S3 Protection should be enabled
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether GuardDuty S3 Protection is enabled. For a standalone account, the control fails if GuardDuty S3 Protection is disabled in the account. In a multi-account environment, the control fails if the delegated GuardDuty administrator account and all member accounts don't have S3 Protection enabled.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: GuardDuty Runtime Monitoring should be enabled
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether Runtime Monitoring is enabled in Amazon GuardDuty. For a standalone account, the control fails if GuardDuty Runtime Monitoring is disabled for the account. In a multi-account environment, the control fails if GuardDuty Runtime Monitoring is disabled for the delegated GuardDuty administrator account and all member accounts.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: GuardDuty ECS Runtime Monitoring should be enabled
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether the Amazon GuardDuty automated security agent is enabled for runtime monitoring of Amazon ECS clusters on AWS Fargate. For a standalone account, the control fails if the security agent is disabled for the account. In a multi-account environment, the control fails if the security agent is disabled for the delegated GuardDuty administrator account and all member accounts.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: GuardDuty EC2 Runtime Monitoring should be enabled
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether the Amazon GuardDuty automated security agent is enabled for runtime monitoring of Amazon EC2 instances. For a standalone account, the control fails if the security agent is disabled for the account. In a multi-account environment, the control fails if the security agent is disabled for the delegated GuardDuty administrator account and all member accounts.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: GuardDuty EKS Audit Log Monitoring should be enabled
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether GuardDuty EKS Audit Log Monitoring is enabled. For a standalone account, the control fails if GuardDuty EKS Audit Log Monitoring is disabled in the account. In a multi-account environment, the control fails if the delegated GuardDuty administrator account and all member accounts don't have EKS Audit Log Monitoring enabled.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: GuardDuty Lambda Protection should be enabled
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether GuardDuty Lambda Protection is enabled. For a standalone account, the control fails if GuardDuty Lambda Protection is disabled in the account. In a multi-account environment, the control fails if the delegated GuardDuty administrator account and all member accounts don't have Lambda Protection enabled.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: GuardDuty EKS Runtime Monitoring should be enabled
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether GuardDuty EKS Runtime Monitoring with automated agent management is enabled. For a standalone account, the control fails if GuardDuty EKS Runtime Monitoring with automated agent management is disabled in the account. In a multi-account environment, the control fails if the delegated GuardDuty administrator account and all member accounts don't have EKS Runtime Monitoring with automated agent management enabled.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: GuardDuty Malware Protection for EC2 should be enabled
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether GuardDuty Malware Protection for EC2 is enabled. For a standalone account, the control fails if GuardDuty Malware Protection for EC2 is disabled in the account. In a multi-account environment, the control fails if the delegated GuardDuty administrator account and all member accounts don't have Malware Protection for EC2 enabled.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: GuardDuty RDS Protection should be enabled
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether GuardDuty RDS Protection is enabled. For a standalone account, the control fails if GuardDuty RDS Protection is disabled in the account. In a multi-account environment, the control fails if the delegated GuardDuty administrator account and all member accounts don't have RDS Protection enabled.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: IAM policies should not allow full "*" administrative privileges
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This AWS control checks whether the default version of AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) policies (also known as customer managed policies) do not have administrator access with a statement that has "Effect": "Allow" with "Action": "*" over "Resource": "*". It only checks for the Customer Managed Policies that you created, but not inline and AWS Managed Policies.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: IAM users should not have IAM policies attached
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This AWS control checks that none of your IAM users have policies attached. Instead, IAM users must inherit permissions from IAM groups or roles.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: IAM customer managed policies that you create should not allow wildcard actions for services
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether the IAM identity-based custom policies have Allow statements that grant permissions for all actions on a service. The control fails if any policy statement includes "Effect": "Allow" with "Action": "Service:*".

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: IAM users' access keys should be rotated every 90 days or less
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This AWS control checks whether the active access keys are rotated within 90 days.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: IAM root user access key should not exist
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This AWS control checks whether the root user access key is available.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: MFA should be enabled for all IAM users that have a console password
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This AWS control checks whether AWS Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA) is enabled for all AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) users that use a console password.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: Hardware MFA should be enabled for the root user
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This AWS control checks whether your AWS account is enabled to use a hardware multi-factor authentication (MFA) device to sign in with root user credentials.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: Password policies for IAM users should have strong configurations
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether the account password policy for IAM users uses strong configurations. The control fails if the password policy doesn't use strong configurations. Unless you provide custom parameter values, Security Hub uses the default values mentioned in the preceding table. The 'PasswordReusePrevention' and 'MaxPasswordAge' parameters have no default value, so if you exclude these parameters, Security Hub ignores number of password rotations and password age when evaluating this control.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: Unused IAM user credentials should be removed
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether your IAM users have passwords or active access keys that were not used within the previous 90 days.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: Amazon Inspector EC2 scanning should be enabled
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether Amazon Inspector EC2 scanning is enabled. For a standalone account, the control fails if Amazon Inspector EC2 scanning is disabled in the account. In a multi-account environment, the control fails if the delegated Inspector administrator account and all member accounts don't have EC2 scanning enabled.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: Amazon Inspector ECR scanning should be enabled
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether Amazon Inspector ECR scanning is enabled. For a standalone account, the control fails if Amazon Inspector ECR scanning is disabled in the account. In a multi-account environment, the control fails if the delegated Inspector administrator account and all member accounts don't have ECR scanning enabled.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: Amazon Inspector Lambda code scanning should be enabled
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether Amazon Inspector Lambda code scanning is enabled. For a standalone account, the control fails if Amazon Inspector Lambda code scanning is disabled in the account. In a multi-account environment, the control fails if the delegated Inspector administrator account and all member accounts don't have Lambda code scanning enabled.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: Amazon Inspector Lambda standard scanning should be enabled
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether Amazon Inspector Lambda standard scanning is enabled. For a standalone account, the control fails if Amazon Inspector Lambda standard scanning is disabled in the account. In a multi-account environment, the control fails if the delegated Inspector administrator account and all member accounts don't have Lambda standard scanning enabled.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: IAM customer managed policies should not allow decryption actions on all KMS keys
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: Checks whether the default version of IAM customer managed policies allow principals to use the AWS Key Management Service (KMS) decryption actions on all resources. This control fails if kms:Decrypt or kms:ReEncryptFrom actions are allowed on all KMS keys. The control evaluates both attached and unattached customer managed policies. It does not check inline policies or AWS managed policies.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: IAM principals should not have IAM inline policies that allow decryption actions on all KMS keys
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: Checks whether the inline policies embedded in your IAM principals (Role/User/Group) allow the AWS Key Management Service (KMS) decryption actions on all KMS keys. This control fails if kms:Decrypt or kms:ReEncryptFrom actions are allowed on all KMS keys in an inline policy.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: AWS KMS keys should not be deleted unintentionally
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether AWS Key Management Service (KMS) customer managed keys (CMK) are scheduled for deletion. The control fails if a KMS CMK is scheduled for deletion.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: KMS keys should not be publicly accessible
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This controls checks whether an AWS KMS key is publicly accessible. The control fails if the KMS key is publicly accessible.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: Kinesis streams should be encrypted at rest
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks if Kinesis streams are encrypted at rest with server-side encryption. This control fails if a Kinesis stream is not encrypted at rest with server-side encryption.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: Kinesis streams should have an adequate data retention period
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon Kinesis data stream has a data retention period greater than or equal to the specified time frame. The control fails if the data retention period is less than the specified time frame. Unless you provide a custom parameter value for the data retention period, Security Hub uses a default value of 168 hours.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: Lambda function policies should prohibit public access
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether the AWS Lambda function policy attached to the Lambda resource prohibits public access. If the Lambda function policy allows public access, the control fails.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: Lambda functions should use supported runtimes
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether Lambda function runtime settings match the expected values set for the supported runtimes in each language. The control fails if a Lambda function doesn't use a supported runtime.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: VPC Lambda functions should operate in multiple Availability Zones
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks if an AWS Lambda function that connects to a virtual private cloud (VPC) operates in at least the specified number of Availability Zone (AZs). The control fails if the function doesn't operate in at least the specified number of AZs. Unless you provide a custom parameter value for the minimum number of AZs, Security Hub uses a default value of two AZs.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: ActiveMQ brokers should stream audit logs to CloudWatch
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon MQ ActiveMQ broker streams audit logs to Amazon CloudWatch Logs. The control fails if the broker doesn't stream audit logs to CloudWatch Logs.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: Amazon MQ brokers should have automatic minor version upgrade enabled
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon MQ broker has automatic minor version upgrade enabled. The control fails if the broker doesn't have automatic minor version upgrade enabled.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: MSK clusters should be encrypted in transit among broker nodes
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This controls checks if a MSK cluster allows encryption in transit using HTTPS(TLS) among the broker nodes of the cluster. The control fails if plain text communication is enabled for in cluster broker node connection.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: MSK Connect connectors should be encrypted in transit
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon MSK Connect connector is encrypted in transit. The control fails if the connector isn't encrypted in transit.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: Macie should be enabled
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether Amazon Macie is enabled for an account. The control fails if Macie isn't enabled for the account.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: Macie automated sensitive data discovery should be enabled
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether automated sensitive data discovery is enabled for an Amazon Macie administrator account. The control fails if automated sensitive data discovery isn't enabled for a Macie administrator account. The control doesn't generate a finding for member accounts.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: Neptune DB clusters should be encrypted at rest
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether a Neptune DB cluster is encrypted at rest. The control fails if a Neptune DB cluster isn't encrypted at rest.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: Neptune DB clusters should publish audit logs to CloudWatch Logs
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether a Neptune DB cluster publishes audit logs to Amazon CloudWatch Logs. The control fails if a Neptune DB cluster doesn't publish audit logs to CloudWatch Logs. `EnableCloudWatchLogsExport` should be set to Audit.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: Neptune DB cluster snapshots should not be public
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether a Neptune manual DB cluster snapshot is public. The control fails if a Neptune manual DB cluster snapshot is public.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: Neptune DB clusters should have deletion protection enabled
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks if a Neptune DB cluster has deletion protection enabled. The control fails if a Neptune DB cluster doesn't have deletion protection enabled.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: Neptune DB clusters should have automated backups enabled
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether a Neptune DB cluster has automated backups enabled, and a backup retention period greater than or equal to the specified time frame. The control fails if backups aren't enabled for the Neptune DB cluster, or if the retention period is less than the specified time frame. Unless you provide a custom parameter value for the backup retention period, Security Hub uses a default value of 7 days.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: Neptune DB cluster snapshots should be encrypted at rest
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether a Neptune DB cluster snapshot is encrypted at rest. The control fails if a Neptune DB cluster isn't encrypted at rest.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: Neptune DB clusters should have IAM database authentication enabled
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks if a Neptune DB cluster has IAM database authentication enabled. The control fails if IAM database authentication isn't enabled for a Neptune DB cluster.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: Neptune DB clusters should be configured to copy tags to snapshots
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks if a Neptune DB cluster is configured to copy all tags to snapshots when the snapshots are created. The control fails if a Neptune DB cluster isn't configured to copy tags to snapshots.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: Network Firewall firewalls should have subnet change protection enabled
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether subnet change protection is enabled for an AWS Network Firewall firewall. The control fails if subnet change protection isn't enabled for the firewall.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: Network Firewall logging should be enabled
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether logging is enabled for an AWS Network Firewall firewall. The control fails if logging isn't enabled for at least one log type or if the logging destination doesn't exist.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: Network Firewall policies should have at least one rule group associated
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether a Network Firewall policy has any stateful or stateless rule groups associated. This control fails if stateless or stateful rule groups are not assigned.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: The default stateless action for Network Firewall policies should be drop or forward for full packets
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether the default stateless action for full packets for a Network Firewall policy is drop or forward. The control passes if Drop or Forward is selected, and fails if Pass is selected.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: The default stateless action for Network Firewall policies should be drop or forward for fragmented packets
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether the default stateless action for fragmented packets for a Network Firewall policy is drop or forward. The control passes if Drop or Forward is selected, and fails if Pass is selected.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: Stateless network firewall rule group should not be empty
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks if a Stateless Network Firewall Rule Group contains rules. The rule will fail if there are no rules in a Stateless Network Firewall Rule Group.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: Network Firewall firewalls should have deletion protection enabled
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether an AWS Network Firewall firewall has deletion protection enabled. The control fails if deletion protection isn't enabled for a firewall.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: OpenSearch domains should have encryption at rest enabled
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether Amazon OpenSearch domains have encryption-at-rest configuration enabled. The check fails if encryption at rest is not enabled.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: OpenSearch domains should have the latest software update installed
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon OpenSearch Service domain has the latest software update installed. The control fails if a software update is available but not installed for the domain.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: OpenSearch domains should not be publicly accessible
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether an OpenSearch domain is publicly accessible. The control fails if an OpenSearch domain is publicly accessible. It does not evaluate the VPC subnet routing configuration to determine public access.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: OpenSearch domains should encrypt data sent between nodes
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether Amazon OpenSearch domains have node-to-node encryption enabled. This control fails if node-to-node encryption is disabled on the domain.
