SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: OpenSearch domain error logging to CloudWatch Logs should be enabled
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether Amazon OpenSearch domains are configured to send error logs to CloudWatch Logs. This control fails if error logging to CloudWatch is not enabled for a domain.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: OpenSearch domains should have audit logging enabled
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether Amazon OpenSearch Service domains have audit logging enabled.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: OpenSearch domains should have at least three data nodes
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether Amazon OpenSearch Service domains are configured with at least three data nodes and "zoneAwarenessEnabled" is true.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: OpenSearch domains should have fine-grained access control enabled
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether Amazon OpenSearch domains have fine-grained access control enabled. This control fails if the fine-grained access control is not enabled.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: Connections to OpenSearch domains should be encrypted using the latest TLS security policy
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This controls checks whether connections to an Amazon OpenSearch Service domain are using the latest TLS security policy. The control fails if the OpenSearch domain isn't using the latest supported policy or if HTTPs isn't enabled.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: AWS Private CA root certificate authority should be disabled
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks if AWS Private CA has a root certificate authority (CA) that is disabled. This control fails if the root CA is enabled.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: RDS snapshot should be private
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This AWS control checks if Amazon Relational Database Service (Amazon RDS) snapshots are public.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: IAM authentication should be configured for RDS instances
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether an RDS DB instance has IAM database authentication enabled.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: RDS instances should have automatic backups enabled
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon Relational Database Service instance has automated backups enabled, and a backup retention period greater than or equal to the specified time frame. Read replicas are excluded from evaluation. The control fails if backups aren't enabled for the instance, or if the retention period is less than the specified time frame. Unless you provide a custom parameter value for the backup retention period, Security Hub uses a default value of 7 days.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: IAM authentication should be configured for RDS clusters
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks if an RDS DB cluster has IAM database authentication enabled.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: RDS automatic minor version upgrades should be enabled
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks if automatic minor version upgrades are enabled for the Amazon RDS database instance.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: Amazon Aurora clusters should have backtracking enabled
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon Aurora cluster has backtracking enabled. The control fails if the cluster doesn't have backtracking enabled. If you provide a custom value for the 'BacktrackWindowInHours' parameter, the control passes only if the cluster is backtracked for the specified length of time.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: RDS DB clusters should be configured for multiple Availability Zones
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks if Amazon RDS DB clusters are configured with multiple Availability Zones.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: RDS DB clusters should be configured to copy tags to snapshots
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether RDS DB clusters are configured to copy all tags to snapshots when the snapshots are created.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: RDS DB instances should be configured to copy tags to snapshots
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether RDS DB instances are configured to copy all tags to snapshots when the snapshots are created.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: Existing RDS event notification subscriptions should be configured for critical cluster events
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon RDS Event subscription for RDS clusters is configured to notify on event categories of both "maintenance" and "failure".

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: RDS DB Instances should prohibit public access, as determined by the PubliclyAccessible configuration
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This AWS control checks whether RDS instances are publicly accessible by evaluating the publiclyAccessible field in the instance configuration item.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: Existing RDS event notification subscriptions should be configured for critical database instance events
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon RDS Event subscription for RDS instances is configured to notify on event categories of both "maintenance", "configuration change", and "failure".

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: An RDS event notifications subscription should be configured for critical database parameter group events
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon RDS Event subscription for RDS parameter groups is configured to notify on event category of "configuration change".

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: An RDS event notifications subscription should be configured for critical database security group events
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon RDS Event subscription for RDS security groups is configured to notify on event categories of both "configuration change" and "failure".

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: RDS instances should not use a database engine default port
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether RDS instances use the default port of that database engine.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: RDS Database Clusters should use a custom administrator username
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether an RDS database cluster has changed the admin username from its default value. This rule will fail if the admin username is set to the default value.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: RDS database instances should use a custom administrator username
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon Relational Database Service (Amazon RDS) database instance has changed the admin username from its default value. This rule will only run on RDS database instances. The rule will fail if the admin username is set to the default value.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: RDS DB clusters should be encrypted at rest
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks if an RDS DB cluster is encrypted at rest. The control fails if an RDS DB cluster isn't encrypted at rest.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: RDS DB instances should have encryption at-rest enabled
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This AWS control checks whether storage encryption is enabled for your RDS DB instances.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: Aurora MySQL DB clusters should publish audit logs to CloudWatch Logs
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon Aurora MySQL DB cluster is configured to publish audit logs to Amazon CloudWatch Logs. The control fails if the cluster isn’t configured to publish audit logs to CloudWatch Logs.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: RDS DB clusters should have automatic minor version upgrade enabled
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks if automatic minor version upgrade is enabled for an Amazon RDS database cluster. This control fails if automatic minor version upgrade isn't enabled for an RDS cluster.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: RDS for PostgreSQL DB instances should publish logs to CloudWatch Logs
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon RDS for PostgreSQL DB instance is configured to publish logs to Amazon CloudWatch Logs. The control fails if the PostgreSQL DB instance isn't configured to publish the log types mentioned in the 'logTypes' parameter to CloudWatch Logs.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: Aurora PostgreSQL DB clusters should publish logs to CloudWatch Logs
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon Aurora PostgreSQL DB cluster is configured to publish PostgreSQL logs to Amazon CloudWatch Logs. The control fails if the Aurora PostgreSQL DB cluster isn't configured to publish PostgreSQL logs to CloudWatch Logs.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: RDS for PostgreSQL DB instances should be encrypted in transit
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether a connection to an Amazon RDS for PostgreSQL database (DB) instance is encrypted in transit. The control fails if the rds.force_ssl parameter for the parameter group associated with the instance is set to 0.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: RDS for MySQL DB instances should be encrypted in transit
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether a connection to an Amazon RDS for MySQL database (DB) instance is encrypted in transit. The control fails if the rds.require_secure_transport parameter for the parameter group associated with the instance is set to 0 (off).

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: RDS cluster snapshots and database snapshots should be encrypted at rest
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether Amazon RDS cluster snapshots and database snapshots are encrypted.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: RDS for SQL Server DB instances should publish logs to CloudWatch Logs
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon RDS for Microsoft SQL Server DB instance is configured to publish logs to Amazon CloudWatch Logs. The control fails if the RDS for SQL Server DB instance isn't configured to publish logs to CloudWatch Logs. You can optionally specify the types of logs that a DB instance should be configured to publish.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: RDS for SQL Server DB instances should be encrypted in transit
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether a connection to an Amazon RDS for Microsoft SQL Server DB instance is encrypted in transit. The control fails if the rds.force_ssl parameter of the parameter group associated with the DB instance is set to 0 (off).

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: RDS for MariaDB DB instances should publish logs to CloudWatch Logs
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon RDS for MariaDB DB instance is configured to publish certain types of logs to Amazon CloudWatch Logs. The control fails if the MariaDB DB instance isn't configured to publish the logs to CloudWatch Logs. You can optionally specify which types of logs a MariaDB DB instance should be configured to publish.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: RDS for MariaDB DB instances should be encrypted in transit
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether connections to an Amazon RDS for MariaDB DB instance are encrypted in transit. The control fails if the DB parameter group associated with the DB instance is not in sync, or the rds.require_secure_transport parameter of the parameter group associated with the instance is set to 0 (off).

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: RDS DB instances should be configured with multiple Availability Zones
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether high availability is enabled for your RDS DB instances.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: Enhanced monitoring should be configured for RDS DB instances
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether enhanced monitoring is enabled for an Amazon Relational Database Service (Amazon RDS) DB instance. The control fails if enhanced monitoring isn't enabled for the instance. If you provide a custom value for the 'monitoringInterval' parameter, the control passes only if enhanced monitoring metrics are collected for the instance at the specified interval.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: RDS clusters should have deletion protection enabled
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether RDS clusters have deletion protection enabled.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: RDS DB instances should have deletion protection enabled
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether RDS DB instances have deletion protection enabled.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: RDS DB instances should publish logs to CloudWatch Logs
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon RDS DB instance is configured to publish the following logs to Amazon CloudWatch Logs. The control fails if the instance isn’t configured to publish the following logs to CloudWatch Logs: Oracle: (Alert, Audit, Trace, Listener), PostgreSQL: (Postgresql, Upgrade), MySQL: (Audit, Error, General, SlowQuery), MariaDB: (Audit, Error, General, SlowQuery), SQL Server: (Error, Agent), Aurora: (Audit, Error, General, SlowQuery), Aurora-MySQL: (Audit, Error, General, SlowQuery), Aurora-PostgreSQL: (Postgresql).

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: Amazon Redshift clusters should prohibit public access
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether Amazon Redshift clusters are publicly accessible. It evaluates the publiclyAccessible field in the cluster configuration item.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: Redshift clusters should be encrypted at rest
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks if an Amazon Redshift cluster is encrypted at rest. The control fails if a Redshift cluster isn't encrypted at rest.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: Redshift security groups should allow ingress on the cluster port only from restricted origins
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether a security group associated with an Amazon Redshift cluster has ingress rules that permit access to the cluster port from the internet (0.0.0.0/0 or ::/0). The control fails if the security group ingress rules permit access to the cluster port from the internet.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: Connections to Amazon Redshift clusters should be encrypted in transit
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether connections to Amazon Redshift clusters are required to use encryption in transit. The check fails if the Amazon Redshift cluster parameter require_SSL is not set to 1.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: Amazon Redshift clusters should have automatic snapshots enabled
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon Redshift cluster has automated snapshots enabled, and a retention period greater than or equal to the specified time frame. The control fails if automated snapshots aren't enabled for the cluster, or if the retention period is less than the specified time frame. Unless you provide a custom parameter value for the retention period, Security Hub uses a default value of 7 days.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: Amazon Redshift clusters should have audit logging enabled
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon Redshift cluster has audit logging enabled.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: Amazon Redshift should have automatic upgrades to major versions enabled
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon Redshift cluster is configured with automatic upgrades to major versions.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: Redshift clusters should use enhanced VPC routing
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether a Redshift cluster has EnhancedVpcRouting enabled.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: Amazon Redshift clusters should not use the default Admin username
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether a Redshift cluster has changed the Admin username from its default value. This control will fail if the admin username for a Redshift cluster is set to 'awsuser'.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: Redshift clusters should not use the default database name
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether a Redshift cluster has changed the database name from its default value. This control will fail if the database name for a Redshift cluster is set to “dev”

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: Amazon Redshift Serverless workgroups should use enhanced VPC routing
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether enhanced VPC routing is enabled for an Amazon Redshift Serverless workgroup. The control fails if enhanced VPC routing is disabled for the workgroup.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: Connections to Redshift Serverless workgroups should be required to use SSL
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether connections to an Amazon Redshift Serverless workgroup are required to encrypt data in transit. The control fails if the `require_ssl` configuration parameter for the workgroup is set to `false`.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: Redshift Serverless workgroups should prohibit public access
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether public access is disabled for an Amazon Redshift Serverless workgroup. It evaluates the publiclyAccessible property of a Redshift Serverless workgroup. The control fails if public access is enabled (true) for the workgroup.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: Redshift Serverless namespaces should not use the default admin username
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether the admin username for an Amazon Redshift Serverless namespace is the default admin username, 'admin'. The control fails if the admin username for the Redshift Serverless namespace is 'admin'. You can optionally specify a list of admin usernames for the control to include in the evaluation.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: Redshift Serverless namespaces should export logs to CloudWatch Logs
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon Redshift Serverless namespace is configured to export connection and user logs to Amazon CloudWatch Logs. The control fails if the Redshift Serverless namespace isn't configured to export the logs to CloudWatch Logs.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: Redshift Serverless namespaces should not use the default database name
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon Redshift Serverless namespace uses the default database name, "dev". The control fails if the Redshift Serverless namespace uses the default database name, "dev".

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: Route 53 public hosted zones should log DNS queries
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks if DNS query logging is enabled for an Amazon Route 53 public hosted zone. The control fails if DNS query logging isn't enabled for a Route 53 public hosted zone.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: S3 general purpose buckets should have block public access settings enabled
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether the preceding Amazon S3 block public access settings are configured at the account level for an S3 general purpose bucket. The control fails if one or more of the block public access settings are set to false.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: ACLs should not be used to manage user access to S3 general purpose buckets
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon S3 general purpose bucket provides user permissions with an access control list (ACL). The control fails if an ACL is configured for managing user access on the bucket.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: S3 general purpose buckets should have Lifecycle configurations
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon S3 general purpose bucket has a Lifecycle configuration. The control fails if the bucket doesn't have a Lifecycle configuration. You can provide custom values for one or more if the preceding parameters, the control passes only if the policy includes the specified storage class, deletion time, and transition time.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: S3 access points should have block public access settings enabled
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon S3 access point has block public access settings enabled. The control fails if block public access settings aren't enabled for the access point.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: S3 general purpose buckets should block public read access
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon S3 general purpose bucket permits public read access. It evaluates the block public access settings, the bucket policy, and the bucket access control list (ACL). The control fails if the bucket permits public read access.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: S3 Multi-Region Access Points should have block public access settings enabled
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon S3 Multi-Region Access Point has block public access settings enabled. The control fails if the Multi-Region Access Point doesn't have block public access settings enabled.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: S3 general purpose buckets should block public write access
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon S3 general purpose bucket permits public write access. It evaluates the block public access settings, the bucket policy, and the bucket access control list (ACL). The control fails if the bucket permits public write access.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: S3 general purpose buckets should require requests to use SSL
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon S3 general purpose bucket has a policy that requires requests to use SSL. The control fails if the bucket policy doesn't require requests to use SSL.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: S3 general purpose bucket policies should restrict access to other AWS accounts
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon S3 general purpose bucket policy prevents principals from other AWS accounts from performing denied actions on resources in the S3 bucket. The control fails if the bucket policy allows one or more of the preceding actions for a principal in another AWS account.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: S3 general purpose buckets should block public access
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon S3 general purpose bucket blocks public access at the bucket level. The control fails if any of the following settings are set to false: ignorePublicAcls, blockPublicPolicy, blockPublicAcls, restrictPublicBuckets.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: S3 general purpose buckets should have server access logging enabled
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether server access logging is enabled for an Amazon S3 general purpose bucket. The control fails if server access logging isn't enabled. When logging is enabled, Amazon S3 delivers access logs for a source bucket to a chosen target bucket. The target bucket must be in the same AWS Region as the source bucket and must not have a default retention period configured. The target logging bucket does not need to have server access logging enabled, and you should suppress findings for this bucket.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: SNS topic access policies should not allow public access
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon SNS topic access policy allows public access. The control fails if the SNS topic access policy allows public access.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: Amazon SQS queues should be encrypted at rest
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether Amazon SQS queues are encrypted at rest.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: SQS queue access policies should not allow public access
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This controls checks whether an Amazon SQS access policy allows public access to an SQS queue. The control fails if an SQS access policy allows public access to the queue.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: EC2 instances should be managed by AWS Systems Manager
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This AWS control checks whether the Amazon EC2 instances in your account are managed by AWS Systems Manager.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: EC2 instances managed by Systems Manager should have a patch compliance status of COMPLIANT after a patch installation
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This AWS control checks whether the compliance status of the Amazon EC2 Systems Manager patch compliance is COMPLIANT or NON_COMPLIANT after the patch installation on the instance. It only checks instances that are managed by AWS Systems Manager Patch Manager.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: EC2 instances managed by Systems Manager should have an association compliance status of COMPLIANT
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This AWS control checks whether the status of the AWS Systems Manager association compliance is COMPLIANT or NON_COMPLIANT after the association is executed on an instance.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: SSM documents should not be public
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether AWS Systems Manager documents that the account owns are public. This control fails if SSM documents that have "Self" as the owner are public.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: Amazon SageMaker notebook instances should not have direct internet access
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This AWS control checks whether direct internet access is disabled for an Amazon SageMaker notebook instance by examining the DirectInternetAccess field is disabled for an Amazon SageMaker notebook instance.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: SageMaker notebook instances should be launched in a custom VPC
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks if an Amazon SageMaker notebook instance is launched within a custom VPC. The control fails if a SageMaker notebook instance is not launched within a custom VPC.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: Users should not have root access to SageMaker notebook instances
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether root access is turned off for Amazon SageMaker notebook instances. The control fails if root access is turned on for a SageMaker notebook instance.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: SageMaker endpoint production variants should have an initial instance count greater than 1
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether production variants of an Amazon SageMaker endpoint have an initial instance count greater than 1. The control fails if the endpoint's production variants have only 1 initial instance.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: SageMaker models should block inbound traffic
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon SageMaker hosted model blocks inbound network traffic. The control fails if the EnableNetworkIsolation parameter for the hosted model is set to False.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: SageMaker notebook instances should run on supported platforms
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon SageMaker AI notebook instance is configured to run on a supported platform, based on the platform identifier specified for the notebook instance. The control fails if the notebook instance is configured to run on a platform that's no longer supported.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: Secrets Manager secrets should have automatic rotation enabled
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether a secret stored in AWS Secrets Manager is configured with automatic rotation. The control fails if the secret isn't configured with automatic rotation. If you provide a custom value for the 'maximumAllowedRotationFrequency' parameter, the control passes only if the secret is automatically rotated within the specified window of time.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: Secrets Manager secrets configured with automatic rotation should rotate successfully
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether an AWS Secrets Manager secret rotated successfully based on the rotation schedule. The control fails if RotationOccurringAsScheduled is false. The control does not evaluate secrets that do not have rotation configured.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: Remove unused Secrets Manager secrets
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether an AWS Secrets Manager secret has been accessed within the specified time frame. The control fails if a secret is unused beyond the specified time frame. Unless you provide a custom parameter value for the access period, Security Hub uses a default value of 90 days.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: Secrets Manager secrets should be rotated within a specified number of days
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether an AWS Secrets Manager secret is rotated at least once within the specified time frame. The control fails if a secret isn't rotated at least this frequently. Unless you provide a custom parameter value for the rotation period, Security Hub uses a default value of 90 days.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: Service Catalog portfolios should be shared within an AWS organization only
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether AWS Service Catalog shares portfolios within an organization when the integration with AWS Organizations is enabled. The control fails if portfolios aren't shared within an organization.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: Step Functions state machines should have logging turned on
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This controls checks whether an AWS Step Functions state machine has logging turned on. The control fails if a state machine doesn't have logging turned on. If you provide a custom value for the 'logLevel' parameter, the control passes only if the state machine has the specified logging level turned on.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: Transfer Family servers should not use FTP protocol for endpoint connection
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether an AWS Transfer Family server uses a protocol other than FTP for endpoint connection. The control fails if the server uses FTP protocol for a client to connect to the server's endpoint.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: Transfer Family connectors should have logging enabled
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether Amazon CloudWatch logging is enabled for an AWS Transfer Family connector. The control fails if CloudWatch logging isn't enabled for the connector.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: AWS WAF Classic Global Web ACL logging should be enabled
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether logging is enabled for a WAF global Web ACL. This control fails if logging is not enabled for the Web ACL.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: AWS WAF web ACLs should have at least one rule or rule group
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether a WAFV2 web ACL contains at least one WAF rule or WAF rule group. The control fails if a web ACL does not contain any WAF rule or rule group.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: AWS WAF rules should have CloudWatch metrics enabled
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether an AWS WAF rule or rule group has CloudWatch metrics enabled. This control fails if the rule or rule group does not have CloudWatch metrics enabled.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: AWS WAF Classic Regional rules should have at least one condition
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether a WAF Regional rule has at least one condition. The control fails if no conditions are present within a rule.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: AWS WAF Classic Regional rule groups should have at least one rule
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether a WAF Regional rule group has at least one rule. The control fails if no rules are present within a rule group.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: AWS WAF Classic Regional web ACLs should have at least one rule or rule group
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether a WAF Regional web ACL contains any WAF rules or WAF rule groups. This control fails if a web ACL does not contain any WAF rules or rule groups.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: AWS WAF Classic global rules should have at least one condition
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether a WAF global rule has at least one condition. This control fails if no conditions are present within a rule.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: AWS WAF Classic global rule groups should have at least one rule
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether a WAF global rule group has at least one rule. The control fails if no rules are present within a rule group.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: AWS WAF Classic global web ACLs should have at least one rule or rule group
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether a WAF global web ACL contains any WAF rules or WAF rule groups. This control fails if a web ACL does not contain any WAF rules or WAF rule groups.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: WorkSpaces user volumes should be encrypted at rest
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether a user volume in an Amazon WorkSpaces WorkSpace is encrypted at rest. The control fails if the WorkSpace user volume isn't encrypted at rest.

SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: WorkSpaces root volumes should be encrypted at rest
SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether a root volume in an Amazon WorkSpaces WorkSpace is encrypted at rest. The control fails if the WorkSpace root volume isn't encrypted at rest.
